QAPair.Question: What is (are) Scurvy ?
QAPair.Answer: Scurvy is a disease that occurs when you have a severe lack of vitamin C (ascorbic acid) in your diet. Scurvy causes general weakness, anemia , gum disease, poor wound healing, and skin hemorrhages . Scurvy is rare in the United States. Older adults who are not getting proper nutrition are most affected by scurvy.
